item.summary: HBaseExecutorService needs to be multi-cluster friendly

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Debugging this with Karthik's help, we found out that the new HBaseExecutorService wasn't multi-cluster friendly because it was named "master", instead of using something less static like host:port. As a matter of fact, in my log I can also see:


2010-06-18 15:35:08,205 DEBUG [main] executor.HBaseExecutorService$HBaseExecutorServiceType(88): Executor service MASTER_CLOSEREGION already running on master

This was in fact detecting the other master's service.
Also HBaseEventHandler has static members like serverManager, and since it's not static it means that when the second master boots up it replaces the instance with his own.
The test I wrote in HBASE-2756, it has to be included in this jira now.
Changing this jira's title to what it really is about.
Attaching the patch file that JD already has tested...

+1 but some nits:

  • Don't set the class attributes to null.
  • Some lines are way over 80 chars, like in ZKUnassignedWatcher

But it passes the test I wrote, going to commit with the little fixes.
Committed to trunk, thanks for the patch Karthik!

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).
